title: Girls brawl over boyfriend nudes
text:
Share on Twitter 
TWO schoolgirls attacked each other by throwing fists and pulling at each other’s hair after a verbal argument turned violent in front of shoppers. 
The students from Wyndham College, Quakers Hill, viciously attacked each other in a food court at Westpoint shopping centre in Blacktown on February 9. 
One female student shouts at another teenager for contacting her boyfriend and requesting nudes, causing tempers to flair. Wyndham College students fight at Westpoint shopping centre at Blacktown. Source: Supplied A verbal confrontation turned physical in a food court. Source: Supplied 
Footage of the fight posted on Facebook shows the verbal argument taking place in front of families. 
“Why the f**k did you ask my boyfriend for nudes that’s the f**king question,” the teenager shouts. 
“Get over yourself,” the student replies. 
“You get over yourself, you’re a f**king s**t asking my boyfriend for nudes,” The teenager shouts in response. 
The profanities continued until the student shouting launches her fist at her classmate’s face. 
The pair pull at each other’s hair and continue to attack each other while surrounded by their peers. 
As they fell to the ground while continuing to scuffle a male student placed himself between the girls in an attempt to separate the fight. 
But despite being pulled apart, one student attempted to charge back into the fight when her friends held her back. The pair were separated after a male school student pulled the girls apart. Source: Supplied One student was held back by friends as she tries to return to the fight.   students involved in the fight have since been disciplined. 
“This incident occurred off school grounds and outside of school hours,’ a NSW Education Department spokesman said. 
“The police have been notified of the incident [and] Wyndham College has taken appropriate disciplinary action.” 
Social media users were shocked to see the fight take place in front of parents and children and condemned their actions. 
“This is ridiculous, you’re in high school now, grow up, honestly,” one said. 
“The immaturity of some of you young girls is disgusting, you girls have some growing up to do who cares about who said what, grow up and move on,” another said. 
Another posted: “Absolutely disgraceful behaviour when are these kids going to realise one punch can kill. I would be absolutely mortified if my daughter carried on like that, listen to the mouths on these kids let alone their behaviour in public.”
